data.shortDescription:
I am currently CHRO & Sr VP- BD & OEM Relations at Mahindra First Choice Wheels Ltd, an auto-tech Company in used vehicle ecosystem.

I have worked in Iron & Steel industry, Telecom industry, Chemical industry, and automobile industry.  Prior to joining Mahindra Group in 2010, I served four Tata companies, as Corporate Quality Head.

I have 30+ years of work experience in the field of operations, TQM/TPM, HR and sales in metallurgical, chemical, telecom and automobile industries. I have significantly contributed to three different organizational transformations in my capacity as Corporate Quality Head and CHRO.  I led an organizational transformational movement, named as Jagran (awakening), where I used tools & techniques like, Appreciative Inquiry, DVF>R model, 7QC tools& QC story, loss cost analysis, 7 -pillars of TPM and DMAIC approach. In current organization, besides many HR best practices I have implemented “Talent 2 Value” model of McKinsey.

I am a certified Six Sigma Black Belt, certified ICF coach and certified FIRO-B user. I have been trained by Michigan Ross &MLU in the areas of general management and by McKinsey in the areas of HR.

My HR articles have been published in “People Matters” and “Economic Times”.

I am a marathoner. I love reading books and watching videos primarily on the topics of latest technologies, HR, & history. I follow writers and influencers like Yuval Harari, Sadhguru Jaggi and Deepak Ch0pra and Sangeet Paul Choudary.

data.shortDescription:
Seasoned HR expert with 25 years enriched and diverse specialist experience across all HR domains in corporate office & shop-floors across sectors like IT, Manufacturing, Engineering, Automobile, Consulting etc. managing multi-locational work-force in large organizations.

Built high-performance, high-energy, well-bonded teams through exemplary leadership & coaching skills (ensuring impact lasts beyond my tenure in the organization).

Worked closely with Big 4 Consulting firms and BCG in driving change management and organization transformation initiatives through collaboration with stakeholders at various levels.

All career movements were in quest of excellence, constantly seeking fresh challenges and learning opportunities once the ongoing assignment was running in ‘auto-pilot’ mode; ideally suited for long-term engagement with thriving organizations.
data.areaOfExpertise:
HR Strategy & Roadmap: Designed and developed the overall HR strategy and implementation roadmap in alignment with business plan and people’s aspirations; developed policies & standard operating procedures to support the organization in meeting its people objectives.

Talent Acquisition & On-boarding: Developed policies & streamlined operating procedures to attract, select and retain the talent segment targeted by the organization. Sourced profiles (IT & non-IT) spanning diverse industry segments across all levels of hierarchy including local hiring for overseas positions and expatriate hiring.

Performance Management: Created performance management framework for organization after defining key result areas and key performance indicators (aligned with business plans) for all Roles within an organization; administering the framework in an online platform on a quarterly basis, linked with quarterly variable pay pay-outs. Identified critical talent (high performance high potentials) and developed customised interventions to keep them engaged and performing at their optimum capacity.

Learning & Development: Conceptualised and implemented the organization’s capability building agenda through need analysis and creation of training execution plans; collaborated with Big 4 Consulting Firm (PwC) in deploying senior leadership development interventions (Development Center & Individual Development Plan). Assessed identified leadership pipeline through an Assessment Center (Advisory Role). Developed content and delivered customised training programs based on organization need.

Compensation & Benefits: Identified key roles within organization, benchmarking them for external parity (Hewitt) to design market-driven compensation; subsequently carried out internal parity exercise for similar role clusters, for identification and corrective intervention for outliers, to drive equitable and performance-driven compensation across the organization.

Employee Engagement: Administered Engagement Survey (Gallup), analysed findings and actionised on identified gaps through OD interventions.

Employee Relations: Built trust through strong human connections across the spectrum (white collar and blue collar employees) which have contributed to the creation and preservation of harmonious working relations, under challenging business circumstances.

Change Management & HR Transformation: Collaborated with Big 4 Consulting Firm (PwC) in driving change management in the organization, starting with the HR function in terms of HR service delivery and HR function effectiveness.

HR Analytics: Tracked all aspects of HR functioning through HR metrices (as mandated by different quality models like PCMM, Malcolm Baldrige), for continuous improvement, process optimization and improving operational efficiency. Leveraged people data for purposeful analysis, to support better strategic decisions.

Labour Laws: Strong understanding of labour laws and their applications with respect to on-going Compliance and in resolving work related issues.

data.shortDescription:
As the Group Chief People Officer at SLK Group, Dhirendra Nath (Dhiren) has led the people strategy in the midst of rapid growth in the company and chartered to make SLK, an employer of choice. A change catalyst who has been a key contributor to the transformative journey of SLK Group, from one company to a bouquet of four companies, driving synergistic capabilities across the tech spectrum. Juggling between building strong leadership and CEO transitions, building an inclusive and sustainable culture, re-engineering the people processes, and tech-enabling it by the digitization of the landscape of HR, Dhiren has closely partnered with business leaders in building an organization that is growth ready.
Dhiren’s career has traversed the length and breadth of corporate HR across different countries, and during the course of his remarkable two-decade journey, has set up and scaled operations in different countries, run large, diversified businesses, and restructured and transformed existing businesses.

With such diverse experience, what drives Dhiren is his relentless pursuit of cracking the code on how to keep employees motivated, hale and hearty at the workplace and enable the organization to scale new peaks of success. He is a regular contributor to various forums and enjoys the opportunity to interact with students on various HR and industry topics.

data.shortDescription:
An experienced executive with 20 plus years of experience in HR Strategy, Organisation Transformation & Change Management, Jhilik’s role at Anthology focuses on creating a great employee experience, internal readiness of employees & creating a culture in line with the company’s growth strategy. As head of Global Learning, her role involves creating an exceptional learning experience not just for employees but also for Anthology’s customers and partners worldwide.

Jhilik’s role was pivotal in the transformation of the legacy company to Anthology as it is today. Ed-tech as an industry has grown in leaps and bounds very quickly and adapting to this change especially during the pandemic years has been critical. With her expertise, Jhilik brought to the forefront a focus on talent strategy that supports individual growth to attract talent. Thus, was born Anthology Academy – an erstwhile, client-exclusive learning center that was extended to support the learning and growth of all Anthologists. Jhilik’s experience in the business and interactions with customers has given her the strength of looking at opportunities for business growth for the company and see her portfolio expand beyond the HR roles.

She also runs the Adoption Services / Changes Management Services for Anthology for the International Markets, as a parallel activity to professional services in putting together roadmaps for product adoption and process acceptance during and post-implementation.

In her earlier roles, she was part of Thomson Reuters India and UK leadership team, where she led the people agenda for Thomson Reuters Merger for South Asia and UK Sales. Prior to that she was Mergers & Acquisitions Head, Thomson Reuters India. Here she successfully led the integration for Thomson Reuters India from 2008 – 2012. She focused on creating a vision and case for change, engaging key stakeholders, aligning the various change levers, leading communications strategies and plans & overseeing the program management of 6000+ staff. She also led the Sales Transformation for Thomson Reuters London for 4000+ Sales staff across UK & Asia. She has also worked on Talent Strategy Design: Aligning Talent Management models to suit organization's stage of growth. She strategized and led the execution of the Talent Management Plan during the Thomson Reuters Merger for over 6000 staff – including Talent risks assessment, building new Capabilities & Competency Modelling

When asked what she loves about her job, she said, “There are so many aspects I love about my job…working with great colleagues across different locations like LATAM, U.S., U.K., Canada & India. I get to understand different cultures, hear fun stories around the world, hear different thoughts & ideas. My role is also unique as I have the privilege of interacting with all my staff as well as our customers globally, which enables me to look at ideas and solutions from both perspectives.”

data.shortDescription:
Since 2014, Santosh has been CHRO of Ashirvad, serving as a strategic advisor to the leadership team on people strategy to enable a highly engaged, high-performing workforce that is aligned to the business vision, mission, and values.

Through robust talent management practices to attract, develop, and retain the right talent, Santosh and his team are creating sustainable people-based competitive advantage. Under his stewardship, Ashirvad is building a customer-centric, people-first culture that fuels its ambition of doubling the organization’s scale and size every four years.

With two decades of experience in leadership roles in HR across education, automobile, construction and mining equipment, and building and material industries, Santosh’s expertise includes design and delivery of robust people practices, driving employee engagement and organization performance, cultural change management, strengthening organizational and people capability, building customer-focused and high-performance teams and digital transformation of HR. He has extensive experience in handling single and multi-location plants and business units in regional and global matrix environments.

An engineering graduate, Santosh also holds a Post Graduate Degree in Management and is also a Prosci certified change management practitioner. He started his career as an entrepreneur before moving to the corporate sector where he worked with Larsen & Toubro Ltd. and Spicer India Ltd. before joining Ashirvad by Aliaxis.

data.shortDescription:
Mr. Savio Dominic is currently working as Director, People Group at the Ryan India office in Hyderabad, supporting 700+ employees and providing international support on Human Resource advisory to global Ryan offices.

In his experience as a Human Resources(HR) professional over the years, he has seen the transformation of HR into a more people-oriented practice. From rolling out offer letters and processing employee exits to driving culture transformation and change management, he strongly believes that no work is mediocre or great.It is how you perceive and what you do that matters. He also believes in the concept of “Do simple things exceedingly well” and, someday, with the experience, you will be able to handle complex projects.Then, you end up doing complex things exceedingly well.

In the space of Talent, he believes that it is necessary for organizations to transform themselves to be more people-centric. Empathy is one of the key attributes that an HR professional must possess to ensure a culture of welcome and acceptance. He believes that every individual, irrespective of the experience, designation, and culture that they come from, has something to teach, and it is our willingness to keep our learning doors open that ultimately counts.

data.shortDescription:
Mr. Vinod Kumar Singh has been the Director (Personnel) of Power Grid Corporation of India Limited since February 2020. Currently, he is also on the board of PTC India Ltd.& SCOPE. He is also a part of the ministerial committee for revamping NPTI, iGOT etc.

Mr. Singh was an integral part of HR at the time of the formation of POWERGRID and facilitated the successful amalgamation of the diverse cultures, skill sets, expectations, policies, and processes, into a single coherent entity. Post joining POWERGRID, he handled issues like Acquisition and absorption of Personnel, Cross-Cultural transformation, Redundancy planning /Re-deployment of personnel, etc which were critical for a successful amalgamation.

He has been a part of the exponential growth of POWERGRID and witnessed the organizations grow to a MAHARATNA CPSE. He has also been instrumental in the development of the state-of-the-art institute POWERGRID ACADEMY OF LEADERSHIP(PAL), which is a center of excellence in Learning and Development
data.areaOfExpertise:
Mr. Vinod Kumar Singh has worked in all facets of HR including amalgamation, turnaround, Learning & Development & Culture Building which gave him exposure to the entire gamut of the company's business.

Mr. Singh has been instrumental in implementing innovative HR, Learning & Development interventions which led to empowerment &organizational growth. He formulated & implemented strategies for organizational development & Management of Change. (Including Organizational diagnosis, Climate Surveys, etc ) by building and sustaining a high-performance work culture across the organization. POWERGRID Knowledge Management Centre, Competency Mapping, web-based Mentoring and Coaching, etc are a few of his contributions to the HR domain.

He has handled several projects pertaining to capacity building for various utilities in India and from overseas. Few worth mentioning are the Capacity Building & Institutional Strengthening project for the North-Eastern States of India involving 9 (nine) power utilities, Capacity Building in HVDC (High Voltage DC) Transmission Systems for KETRACO, Kenya, and various capacity-building programs for other African Countries under collaboration schemes of Government of India like ITECH & SCAPP etc. Under his guidance, POWERGRID HRD has provided capacity-building consultancy to the Central & State PSUs in the power sector right from the induction level and thereby contributing to the sectoral development.

Mr. Singh is also an acclaimed speaker and has delivered sessions on subjects like Motivation, Communication skills, Discipline Management, Self - Development, and the Growth Story of POWERGRID at IIM Ahmedabad, Bangalore, Rohtak, Shillong, NTPC, NHPC, NPTI, MDI, ASCI, etc and also at various prestigious national/international platforms.
data.awardsAchievements: Mr. Singh was instrumental in various accolades & awards bestowed to POWERGRID. Under his leadership POWERGRID has been conferred ATD Best Award, SHRM HR Excellence Award, Best Companies to Work For Award by Great Place to Work, CII National HR Excellence Award, BML Munjal Award for Excellence in Learning and Development, Dun & Bradstreet Award, ISTD award for Innovative Training Practices, The Economic Times Best Organization for Women- 2022, etc. to name a few.

data.shortDescription:
Shalini Nair Kumar is the Head of People and Culture, Communications & Branding and Facilities at Amadeus Labs Bengaluru.

Over a decade ago, Shalini started her journey with Amadeus managing the Business HR function and facilitated the birth of Amadeus Labs, Amadeus worldwide’s 2nd largest Engineering centre worldwide June 2012. She has played a crucial role in facilitating the meteoric growth seen by Amadeus in Bangalore in the past 10 years. Today the centre has grown to have over 2300 best minds in the business onboard and growing.

Shalini’s individual growth has mirrored the growth of the organization, starting out as a BHR a few years ago to rising to the level of Associate Vice President today. With numerous achievements to her credit, not only has she grown in position and stature but has emerged as one of the young CHROs in the IT space.

She has been lauded by the industry for her leadership skills and has been a recipient of the ‘Most Inspirational Human Resources Leader’ award from Times Ascent Dream Companies to Work for, 2 years in a row. Under her leadership, Amadeus has received various industry accolades. Amadeus was ranked 5 in the Times Ascent Dream Companies to work for 2018 list, Great place to work certified 4 years in row until 2020 and listed under the Best Companies to work for in IT-ITES BPM 2018, 3 years in row until 2019. Shalini has also represented Amadeus at a United Nations forum in 2019 in New Delhi.

In her Human Resources journey, Shalini has worked with leading IT organizations in India like Infosys and Satyam. She holds a post-graduate degree in HR and Management. She has received various industry-level awards for her transformational leadership in the HR space and has spoken at various prestigious forums about the evolving talent landscape in India.

data.shortDescription:
With over 25 years of experience in delivering world-class people agenda and culture, Shailesh Singh is Sr. Director & Chief People Officer at Max Life Insurance. He is responsible for developing and implementing successful Human Resources strategies that support the long-term growth and transformation of the organization. As part of the transformation agenda, Shailesh has led Max Life's journey to becoming a ‘Great Place to Work’, while benchmarking organizations' culture and people practices to the very best. Shailesh is committed to enhancing culture, creating value for teams and organizations, raising engagement levels, and developing talent & leadership.
Shailesh introduced Organization & Talent Review process across the organization to systematically and proactively build an organizational talent pool and succession plans. Under his leadership focus on supervisory capability and accountability of the people, the agenda has been further strengthened. Shailesh is a firm believer in making Max Life Values come alive through leadership role modeling and embodiment of Values via Business and HR processes.
Shailesh is also responsible for the company’s societal connect and leads Corporate Social Responsibility initiatives. Prior to joining Max Life Insurance, Shailesh has worked in multiple HR leadership roles in GE Energy, GE Supply-chain, GE Capital, SRF Finance, Eicher Tractors, and National Dairy Development Board (NDDB).
Shailesh served as Region HR Head for GE Energy for Africa, India, and the Middle-East, based in Dubai, for 5 years. Shailesh is a Graduate of Delhi University and a postgraduate from IRMA, Gujarat. An active follower of the pursuit of having a good work-life balance, Shailesh is a badminton enthusiast and an ardent admirer of Urdu poetry.

In her capacity as the HR head, she is responsible for planning, leading, directing, developing, and coordinating the policies, activities, and staff of the Human Resource department, while ensuring legal compliance and implementation of the organizations mission and talent strategy.
